name: AppImage.GitHub.io

description: Universal app store for Linux applications in AppImage, Flatpak, and Snap formats (project abandoned).

description: Portable Software Center for portable AppImage applications.

description: Optional daemon that integrates AppImages into the system (deprecated).

description: Integrates into users' systems and establishes a single ~/Applications directory, assisting the user to move AppImages into there, with support for updating and removing AppImages through apps launcher.

name: appimage2desktop
description: Creates a desktop file and an icon in the system for an AppImage, nothing else.

description: Program for creating, deleting, controlling and organizing shortcuts to AppImage.

name: LinuxPA
description: PortableApps.com type launcher for Linux with AppImage support.

description: Creates menu entries for AppImages without the need for a daemon.

description: Generates icons for AppImages that are shown in file managers of GNOME and KDE compatible desktop environments.

name: AppImage To Gnome

name: AppImageUpdater
description: Simple updater for humans written in C++ and Qt.

name: appimage-update
description: AppImage Update implementation written in Go.

name: Firejail
description: Optional sandbox with support for AppImage built in.

name: AppImage Sandboxing Project
description: Golang library to help sandbox AppImages with bwrap.

name: appimage-manager
description: Command-line tool for managing AppImages allowing to search, install, remove and update applications.

name: bauh
description: Graphical user interface for managing Linux applications supporting AppImage, Arch (repositories/AUR), Flatpak, Snap and native Web applications.

name: homebrew-appimage

name: AIPM
description: A Package Manager for AppImages.

name: Zap
description: AppImage package manager. Downloads the AppImage if it does not exist. If it already exists, updates it with AppImageUpdate. Integrates AppImage into the system.

name: RookiePM
description: Package manager for AppImages and Shell Scripts.

name: AppMan
description: AppImage Manager that works like APT or Pacman.

name: jewelrystore
description: Command line AppImage store made in ruby.

name: ayy
description: Package manager for AppImage. Single, static, dependency free binary. Written in Go.

name: Deepin
description: When you double-click an AppImage or any other executable file that lacks execute permissions, a user-friendly dialog explains the situation and asks for your permission to set the execute permission and execute the executable.

name: Nitrux
description: Promotes the use of AppImage as the main format for getting applications, has a built in app center featuring AppImages.

name: Linux Mint
description: Has an AppImage thumbnailer to show application icons on AppImage files.

name: Zenwalk GNU Linux is "AppImage ready" and distributes some applications in AppImage format.

description: Recipe based AppImage creation tool working from source.

name: appimage-tooling
description: Ruby tooling to generate Appimages.
